availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William "Bill" Sherfield (Hickman County, Kentucky, trader, farmer, and murder victim)

body.p: Hickman County, Kentucky, trader and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of E. Sherfield and Sallie A. Sherfield. Farmer in Graves County, Kentucky, in 1850. Trader in Hickman County in 1860. Allegedly killed by Unionists John M. Bailey and Lewis H. Bailey in Hickman County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Graves County, District 1, p. 439A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Hays District, p. 541.
"Later from Richmond--Jeff. Davis Very Ill with No Hopes of His Recovery," Chicago Tribune, (IL), September 4, 1861, newspapers.com, https://www.newspapers.com/image/466163355.
